Victoria Memorial.accessibility: Wheelchair accessible, Restrooms for people with disabilities
Victoria Memorial.historical_context: Built in memory of Queen Victoria, it is a landmark of Kolkata's architectural heritage.
Victoria Memorial.architecture_features: Combines British and Mughal architecture, featuring a white marble structure with gardens and sculptures.
Victoria Memorial.local_culture_customs: Hosts cultural events and exhibitions showcasing Bengal's heritage, with traditional music and dance performances.
Victoria Memorial.visitor_tips_recommendations: Don't forget to explore the gardens surrounding the memorial and attend the sound and light show in the evenings.
Victoria Memorial.nearby_attractions: Explore nearby attractions such as St. Paul's Cathedral, Maidan Park, and the Indian Museum.
Victoria Memorial.directions: The Victoria Memorial is located in Kolkata, West Bengal. You can reach there by taxi, bus, or metro.
Victoria Memorial.specific_place_info: The Victoria Memorial is a large marble building in Kolkata, West Bengal, India, which was built between 1906 and 1921. It is dedicated to the memory of Queen Victoria (1819â€“1901) and is now a museum and tourist destination under the Ministry of Culture.

Charminar.entrance_fee: INR 100 (Foreign nationals), Free for Indian nationals
Charminar.historical_context: Built in 1591 by Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah, it is a symbol of Hyderabad's heritage and history.
Charminar.architecture_features: Islamic architecture with four grand arches, minarets, and a mosque.
Charminar.local_culture_customs: A center for traditional bazaars, where you can buy pearls, jewelry, and traditional Hyderabadi garments.
Charminar.visitor_tips_recommendations: Visit during the evening to see the monument illuminated and enjoy the bustling market around it.
Charminar.nearby_attractions: Visit nearby attractions such as Mecca Masjid, Chowmahalla Palace, and Laad Bazaar.
Charminar.directions: Charminar is located in the heart of Hyderabad, Telangana. You can reach there by taxi, auto-rickshaw, or bus.
Charminar.specific_place_info: Charminar, meaning 'Four Minarets,' is a historic monument located in Hyderabad, India. It was built in 1591 by Sultan Muhammad Quli Qutb Shah, the fifth ruler of the Qutb Shahi dynasty.

Hampi.accessibility: Partially accessible, some areas may be difficult for wheelchair users
Hampi.historical_context: Once the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire, Hampi is a UNESCO World Heritage Site known for its ancient ruins and temples.
Hampi.architecture_features: Ruins of grand temples, palaces, and monuments showcasing the Vijayanagara architectural style.
Hampi.local_culture_customs: Experience the local culture through traditional music performances and by exploring nearby villages.
Hampi.visitor_tips_recommendations: Rent a bicycle to explore the vast archaeological site comfortably and carry water and snacks as it can get hot.
Hampi.nearby_attractions: Visit attractions such as Virupaksha Temple, Vittala Temple, and Hampi Bazaar.
Hampi.directions: Hampi is located in the northern part of Karnataka, India. The nearest railway station is Hospet, and you can reach Hampi by bus or taxi from there.
Hampi.specific_place_info: Hampi, also known as Pampa-kshetra, Kishkindha-kshetra, or Bhaskara-kshetra, is a village and temple town recognized as a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It was the capital of the Vijayanagara Empire in the 14th century.

Mysore Palace.accessibility: Wheelchair accessible, Elevator available for upper floors
Mysore Palace.historical_context: Built in the 14th century and rebuilt multiple times, Mysore Palace is a symbol of Mysore's royal heritage.
Mysore Palace.architecture_features: Indo-Saracenic style architecture with domes, arches, and intricate artwork.
Mysore Palace.local_culture_customs: Witness the grandeur of the Dasara festival celebrated with cultural performances, processions, and lighting decorations.
Mysore Palace.visitor_tips_recommendations: Visit during the evening to witness the palace illuminated with thousands of lights.
Mysore Palace.nearby_attractions: Explore attractions such as Chamundi Hill, Brindavan Gardens, and Jaganmohan Palace.
Mysore Palace.directions: Mysore Palace is located in the heart of Mysore city in Karnataka, India. You can reach there by taxi, auto-rickshaw, or bus.
Mysore Palace.specific_place_info: Mysore Palace, also known as Amba Vilas Palace, is a historical palace and a royal residence at Mysore in Karnataka, India. It is the official residence of the Wadiyar dynasty and the seat of the Kingdom of Mysore.

India Gate.historical_context: Built as a memorial to commemorate the Indian soldiers who died in World War I, India Gate is an iconic landmark of New Delhi.
India Gate.architecture_features: Triumphal arch with names of soldiers inscribed, surrounded by green lawns and fountains.
India Gate.local_culture_customs: A popular picnic spot for locals, especially during evenings and weekends.
India Gate.visitor_tips_recommendations: Visit during the evening to see the monument illuminated and enjoy street food from nearby vendors.
India Gate.nearby_attractions: Explore nearby attractions such as Rashtrapati Bhavan, National War Memorial, and Parliament House.
India Gate.directions: India Gate is located in the heart of New Delhi, near Rajpath. You can reach there by taxi, auto-rickshaw, or metro.
India Gate.specific_place_info: India Gate is a war memorial located astride the Rajpath, on the eastern edge of the 'ceremonial axis' of New Delhi, India, formerly called Kingsway.

Taj Mahal.accessibility: Partially accessible, wheelchair ramps available at certain points
Taj Mahal.historical_context: Built by Emperor Shah Jahan in memory of his wife Mumtaz Mahal, the Taj Mahal is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and one of the New Seven Wonders of the World.
Taj Mahal.architecture_features: Mughal architecture with white marble, intricate carvings, and a symmetrical layout.
Taj Mahal.local_culture_customs: Witness the changing colors of the marble as the sunlight shifts throughout the day and the moonlight at night.
Taj Mahal.visitor_tips_recommendations: Visit during sunrise or sunset for the best views and fewer crowds, and explore the gardens and the Yamuna River behind the monument.
Taj Mahal.nearby_attractions: Explore attractions such as Agra Fort, Mehtab Bagh, and Itmad-ud-Daula's Tomb.
Taj Mahal.directions: Taj Mahal is located in Agra, Uttar Pradesh, India. You can reach there by taxi, auto-rickshaw, or bus.
Taj Mahal.specific_place_info: The Taj Mahal, meaning 'Crown of the Palace,' is an ivory-white marble mausoleum on the right bank of the river Yamuna in the Indian city of Agra.

Qutub Minar.accessibility: Partially accessible, some areas may be difficult for wheelchair users
Qutub Minar.historical_context: Built in the 12th century by Qutb-ud-din Aibak, Qutub Minar is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and the tallest brick minaret in the world.
Qutub Minar.architecture_features: Afghan architecture with intricate carvings, verses from the Quran, and geometric patterns.
Qutub Minar.local_culture_customs: Witness the Iron Pillar, a metallurgical marvel that has not rusted in over a thousand years.
Qutub Minar.visitor_tips_recommendations: Climb to the top of the minaret for panoramic views of Delhi, and explore the nearby ruins of Quwwat-ul-Islam Mosque and Alai Darwaza.
Qutub Minar.nearby_attractions: Visit attractions such as Mehrauli Archaeological Park, Lotus Temple, and Humayun's Tomb.
Qutub Minar.directions: Qutub Minar is located in Mehrauli, New Delhi, India. You can reach there by taxi, auto-rickshaw, or metro.
Qutub Minar.specific_place_info: Qutub Minar, also spelled as Qutb Minar, is a minaret and victory tower located in the Qutb complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Delhi, India.

Gol Gumbaz.accessibility: Partially accessible, some areas may be difficult for wheelchair users
Gol Gumbaz.historical_context: Built in the 17th century by Muhammad Adil Shah, Gol Gumbaz is the mausoleum of Sultan Bijapur and an architectural marvel.
Gol Gumbaz.architecture_features: Deccan Indo-Islamic architecture with the world's second-largest dome and whispering gallery.
Gol Gumbaz.local_culture_customs: Experience the acoustics of the whispering gallery, where even the faintest whisper echoes multiple times.
Gol Gumbaz.visitor_tips_recommendations: Climb to the top of the dome for panoramic views of Bijapur, and explore the adjacent Ibrahim Rauza complex.
Gol Gumbaz.nearby_attractions: Visit attractions such as Ibrahim Rauza, Jod Gumbad, and Malik-e-Maidan.
Gol Gumbaz.directions: Gol Gumbaz is located in Bijapur, Karnataka, India. You can reach there by taxi, auto-rickshaw, or bus.
Gol Gumbaz.specific_place_info: Gol Gumbaz is the mausoleum of Sultan Mohammed Adil Shah, Sultan of Bijapur. Construction of the tomb was started in 1626 and completed in 1656.

Jantar Mantar.accessibility: Partially accessible, some areas may be difficult for wheelchair users
Jantar Mantar.historical_context: Built by Maharaja Jai Singh II in the 18th century, Jantar Mantar is an astronomical observatory and a UNESCO World Heritage Site.
Jantar Mantar.architecture_features: Large-scale astronomical instruments used for observing celestial positions with naked eye.
Jantar Mantar.local_culture_customs: Learn about ancient Indian astronomy and the significance of celestial bodies in Hindu astrology.
Jantar Mantar.visitor_tips_recommendations: Visit during early morning or late afternoon for clear views of the instruments and attend the guided tours for detailed explanations.
Jantar Mantar.nearby_attractions: Visit attractions such as City Palace, Hawa Mahal, and Albert Hall Museum.
Jantar Mantar.directions: Jantar Mantar is located in Jaipur, Rajasthan, India. You can reach there by taxi, auto-rickshaw, or bus.
Jantar Mantar.specific_place_info: Jantar Mantar is a collection of 19 architectural astronomical instruments built by the Rajput king Sawai Jai Singh II, the founder of Jaipur, Rajasthan. The monument was completed in 1734 CE.

Nalanda University.accessibility: Partially accessible, some areas may be difficult for wheelchair users
Nalanda University.historical_context: Founded in the 5th century AD, Nalanda University was one of the earliest universities in the world and a renowned center for learning.
Nalanda University.architecture_features: Ruins of ancient monasteries, temples, and lecture halls spread across a vast campus.
Nalanda University.local_culture_customs: Discover the rich heritage of Buddhist learning and philosophy that flourished at Nalanda during its heyday.
Nalanda University.visitor_tips_recommendations: Take a guided tour to learn about the history and significance of the university, and explore nearby archaeological sites.
Nalanda University.nearby_attractions: Visit attractions such as Nalanda Archaeological Museum, Xuanzang Memorial, and Nava Nalanda Mahavihara.
Nalanda University.directions: Nalanda University ruins are located near the town of Bihar Sharif in Bihar, India. You can reach there by taxi or bus from nearby towns.
Nalanda University.specific_place_info: Nalanda University was a large Buddhist monastery and center of learning in ancient Magadha (modern-day Bihar), India. It was founded in the 5th century CE and remained active until the 12th century CE.
